018
019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager;
020
021import io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException;
022import io.kubernetes.client.util.Watch;
023import java.io.IOException;
024import java.util.Collections;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Map;
027import java.util.Optional;
028import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
029import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.Constants.VM_OP_GROUP;
030import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8s;
031import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sClient;
032import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicModel;
033import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicModels;
034import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sDynamicStub;
035import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.K8sObserver.ResponseType;
036import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.common.VmPool;
037import static org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.Constants.VM_OP_KIND_VM_POOL;
038import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmDefChanged;
039import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events.VmPoolChanged;
040import org.jdrupes.vmoperator.util.GsonPtr;
041import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
042import org.jgrapes.core.EventPipeline;
043import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
044import org.jgrapes.core.events.Attached;
045
046/**
047 * Watches for changes of VM pools. Reports the changes using 
048 * {@link VmPoolChanged} events fired on a special pipeline to
049 * avoid concurrent change informations.
050 */
051@SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis", "PMD.ExcessiveImports" })
052public class PoolMonitor extends
053        AbstractMonitor<K8sDynamicModel, K8sDynamicModels, Channel> {
054
055    private final Map<String, VmPool> pools = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
056    private EventPipeline poolPipeline;
057
058    /**
059     * Instantiates a new VM pool manager.
060     *
061     * @param componentChannel the component channel
062     * @param channelManager the channel manager
063     */
064    public PoolMonitor(Channel componentChannel) {
065        super(componentChannel, K8sDynamicModel.class,
066            K8sDynamicModels.class);
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * On attached.
071     *
072     * @param event the event
073     */
074    @Handler
075    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.CompareObjectsWithEquals")
076    public void onAttached(Attached event) {
077        if (event.node() == this) {
078            poolPipeline = newEventPipeline();
079        }
080    }
081
082    @Override
083    protected void prepareMonitoring() throws IOException, ApiException {
084        client(new K8sClient());
085
086        // Get all our API versions
087        var ctx = K8s.context(client(), VM_OP_GROUP, "", VM_OP_KIND_VM_POOL);
088        if (ctx.isEmpty()) {
089            logger.severe(() -> "Cannot get CRD context.");
090            return;
091        }
092        context(ctx.get());
093    }
094
095    @Override
096    protected void handleChange(K8sClient client,
097            Watch.Response<K8sDynamicModel> response) {
098
099        var type = ResponseType.valueOf(response.type);
100        var poolName = response.object.metadata().getName();
101
102        // When pool is deleted, save VMs in pending
103        if (type == ResponseType.DELETED) {
104            Optional.ofNullable(pools.get(poolName)).ifPresent(pool -> {
105                pool.setDefined(false);
106                if (pool.vms().isEmpty()) {
107                    pools.remove(poolName);
108                }
109                poolPipeline.fire(new VmPoolChanged(pool, true));
110            });
111            return;
112        }
113
114        // Get full definition
115        var poolModel = response.object;
116        if (poolModel.data() == null) {
117            // ADDED event does not provide data, see
118            // https://github.com/kubernetes-client/java/issues/3215
119            try {
120                poolModel = K8sDynamicStub.get(client(), context(), namespace(),
121                    poolModel.metadata().getName()).model().orElse(null);
122            } catch (ApiException e) {
123                return;
124            }
125        }
126
127        // Get pool and merge changes
128        var vmPool = pools.computeIfAbsent(poolName, k -> new VmPool(poolName));
129        var newData = client().getJSON().getGson().fromJson(
130            GsonPtr.to(poolModel.data()).to("spec").get(), VmPool.class);
131        vmPool.setPermissions(newData.permissions());
132        vmPool.setDefined(true);
133        poolPipeline.fire(new VmPoolChanged(vmPool));
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * Track VM definition changes.
138     *
139     * @param event the event
140     */
141    @Handler
142    public void onVmDefChanged(VmDefChanged event) {
143        String vmName = event.vmDefinition().name();
144        switch (event.type()) {
145        case ADDED:
146            event.vmDefinition().<List<String>> fromSpec("pools")
147                .orElse(Collections.emptyList()).stream().forEach(p -> {
148                    pools.computeIfAbsent(p, k -> new VmPool(p))
149                        .vms().add(vmName);
150                    poolPipeline.fire(new VmPoolChanged(pools.get(p)));
151                });
152            break;
153        case DELETED:
154            pools.values().stream().forEach(p -> {
155                if (p.vms().remove(vmName)) {
156                    poolPipeline.fire(new VmPoolChanged(p));
157                }
158            });
159            break;
160        default:
161            break;
162        }
163    }
164}
